Synonym: Medial nucleus of medial geniculate nucleus
CytoDefiningCriteria: Distinguished by dendritic branching patterns in Golgi impregnated material.  Medial division is characterized by neurons with both tufted and radiate patterns.  In Nissl stains
Medial nucleus of medial geniculate body.MyeloDefiningCriteria: Most heavily myelinated of the 3 divisions;  it is dominated by longitudinal bundles traversing lateral to the medial lemniscus.
DefiningCitation: D. K. (1964) The neuronal structure of the medial geniculate body of the cat.  J. Anat.
Medial nucleus of medial geniculate body.Definition: Medial division of the medial geniculate body, originally described by Morest (1964) in cats but also found in rats (Paxinos, 1995).  In cats, it occupies the ventro-medial quadrant, extending into the fibers of the brachium of the inferior colliculus and adjoining the ventral thalamic nucleus antero-medially.
